page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO SOUTH LAKES
page.content: The area of the survey lies on the eastern side of the Kent Estuary which forms part of Morecambe Bay.It lies midway between Kendal & Lancaster and is close to the Lake District National Park.It is mainly a rural area with Milnthorpe population 2000,the largest settlement in the area.Milnthorpe has a Friday market in the square and acts as a major shopping centre for the surrounding villages.It also has Dallam School which is the secondary school for the area.The area is an undulating lowland which is drained by the River Bela.It has mainly limestone rocks with large areas of boulder clay.Most of the hills are drumlins which have been formed in the past by ice movement from the Lake District.
